question: Which country houses "Mtirala National Park"?
explanation: Georgia houses "Mtirala National Park". Mtirala National Park is an IUCN category II national park and a protected area in Adjara region, Western Georgia. Covering approximately 15,698 hectares in the western Lesser Caucasus, it is situated between the Black Sea and the Adjara Mountains. It also adjoins Kintrishi Protected Areas. Mtirala National Park houses Colchic broad-leaved and mixed forests which include sweet chestnut and Oriental beech woods with pontic rhododendron, cherry laurel and Colcic box understories and a variety of lianas. Local fauna includes the brown bear, roe deer, wild boar, booted eagle, eagle owl, golden oriole, Caucasian salamander, Caucasian toad, Eurasian marsh frog, and Caucasian viper. Mount Mtirala is one of the most humid areas of Georgia.
